name: Wingate by Wyndham Manhattan Midtown

reviews.title: Perfect Hotel for us!
reviews.text: I took my Teenage Nephew and Niece on vacation to NY City for 4 days primarily to see a Yankee game. I researched a lot of hotels around the same price as The Wyndham Manhattan, but none came close in comparison to the amenities that The Wyndham had to offer. The fridge, microwave, free wireless, free water and breakfast were huge benifits and made our visit so much more enjoyable. The room was a good size and exceptionally clean and the bathroom was very spacious, which was a pleasant suprise.
The location was great, close to Macy's, train stations and a 10 minute walk from Time Square.
reviews.title: Perfect Location, Great Stay

reviews.text: The staff was great, and even held all our luggaqe for several hours after we checked out. I would highly recommend The Wyndham and will definately stay there again.
reviews.title: good value good location

reviews.text: K. Darville
reviews.title: Clean and Spacious

likes.liked: — The room size and staff were both wonderful.

reviews.text: Nassau, Bahamas
reviews.title: Excellent Stay

likes.liked: — Spacious clean rooms in great location

reviews.text: Stayed here in mid Sept, we had a standard 2 bed room, which was shared by 3 people. The room was quite small especially when we were all there at the same time, but was perfectly fine in every other respect. It was clean with very comfortable beds, the bathroom was small but adequate (also very clean), and our room was right at the back so no street noise at night at all, apart from when they had a live singer in the bar downstairs one evening. Helpful front desk staff, breakfast wasn't great but not bad considering it's complimentary. We usually had breakfast down at Andrews? Coffee House just one block away from the hotel. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone on a mid range budget.
reviews.title: Nice, clean and comfortable

likes.liked: — Midtown location and very comfortable rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice hotel and friendly staff but a few problems. The noise in this place is terrible at least in the front rooms as garbage trucks seem to go all night. They have a white noise generator in the room but it still doesn't drown out the noise.
reviews.title: ok but

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed 5 days and never got clean towels.
reviews.title: hate the noise

reviews.text: Nice room and amenities. Very warm staff. The noise was awful all day , but unbeareable at night with the garbage trucks working all night in front of the rooms located at the front.
reviews.title: best part of the trip

reviews.text: never return to this place.
reviews.title: Perfect place to stay in Manhattan

reviews.text: We had a great experience here on a 4 night stay in June 2008. The hotel staff was friendly, helpful, efficient and courteous. Kudos to whomever does their hiring!
reviews.title: Great hotel - super service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived exhausted after several flight delays - after 11 PM. The desk staff hooked us up with a welcome microwave popcorn and loads of print info and maps for our visit. We loved having the microwave and frig and daily bottles of water in the room.
reviews.title: Great Rooms, Great Locations

reviews.text: The daily breakfast provided included scrambled eggs, sausage or bacon, toast, bagels, English muffins, and simple pastries, several cereals, waffles, juices, coffee and teas - (buffet-style). It helped not having to buy breakfast every day.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located steps from Macy's - and a short New York walk from Times Square via 7th Avenue.
reviews.title: Would recommend

reviews.text: Kinda cozy - just 6 rooms on each floor. Which we prefer over the massive "super hotels."
reviews.title: Wingate--Friendly, Convenient, Good Deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived early in the morning and checked our bags with the front desk since our room wasn't ready. We got back to the hotel around 7pm to get our room. The clerk was very apologetic in telling us some bad news. The hotel had been overbooked and since we hadn't come back earlier the last room was given to someone else. The good news was that they booked us at the Sheraton in Times Square and were paying for it. They also reimbursed us for our taxi cab fare to the other hotel. Our first night in NYC was free!
reviews.title: A Diamond in the Rough

reviews.text: We checked back in to the Wingate the next morning and were happy to find a much larger room than the Sheraton. The bathroom and beds were very clean and the mini refrigerator in our room was a free added bonus. The internet service was also free.
reviews.title: PRAISE PARTY

likes.liked: — Price, room size, free breakfast and internet, tax included in room price, location
likes.disliked: — Hectic breakfast scene, often running out of food.

reviews.text: The people at the front desk were very helpful with any directions and advice we needed. The free breakfast was the usual foods but perfect and helped save with costs.
reviews.title: Perfect Place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I generally travel to NY for Broadway and stay within 40th and 50th and near Times Square. I wanted to try something different, so we chose to head a little further south. The location was fine. The hotel was not. After our shows, cocktails and some time in Times Square, we returned to our room at 1:15 AM to a blaring Latin Jazz band directly underneath our window. Apparently they do this every Friday night. We requested a room change, but they wouldn't do it. While in the lobby another man came to complain that he had children trying to sleep. They did nothing. I finally called the front desk and demanded a full refund. I give them credit for honoring that; I stayed for free. I would rather pay and have a good night sleep. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: If sleep isn't important, this is the hotel for you.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having travelled from South Africa and having had to book on-line (and we all know what's posted on the net is not always the same in reality!!) I need to let any other future travellers to New York know...I found a gem!!!
reviews.title: Found a gem in New York City!!

reviews.text: This hotel is just a few blocks from Time Square, really well priced and includes a good complimentary breakfast that gives you a great start to the day. The room is a good size for New York, modern and spotless, with a marble bathroom including a bath and shower.
reviews.title: Noisy, Noisy, NOISY, Noisy hotel

reviews.text: With free internet I could update my Facebook to let all know back home what we were experiencing in NY and overall the hotel has added to the whole fantastic experience of New York.....
reviews.title: clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Please DO NOT stay at the Wingate - unfortunately, this is one of my company's preferred hotels and this is my second attempt (my preferred options were all booked out) at staying in this hotel and the last. When booked, I requested a quiet room as my previous experience had taught me not to get a room overlooking the street as the garbage trucks literally roll up and down this street ALL night and the noise is incredible. On arriving I was told I had a room in the front of the hotel - although I was reassured that because it was on the 18th floor - it wouldn't be noisy. My experience from last time told me that this was an incorrect statement. I requested a room at the back and was given a double that looked a bit dusty and unloved. I was informed they were having a halloween party that night and that it could be noisy - now I was prepared for some noise but this is ridiculous - a full on club is now booming in my room. I asked to move - they are now 'full'. I was informed the party would be going on until 4am. I have now been up for 24 hours with no sleep. I am now going to leave.
reviews.title: Repeat customer

reviews.text: NYC is like a second home, and to find a decent, comfortable, very reasonable priced midtown location can be a rare find these days since hotel occupancy is at (and been) a high. Since there are so many hotels to choose - I recently found this one by a Wyndham Rewards promotion and was glad I did, as an affordable option for those frequent weekend trips.
reviews.title: Win-Win for Midtown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is decent - Short blocks to Times Square/theatre district, Madison Sqaure Garden/Penn Station/A C E, 1,2,3 Subway lines (two blocks) and really any central point to the city (Grand Central, Fifth Ave etc etc). From here walks in any direction and you have plenty of food and shopping choices - in the city you never have to walk that far or just get on the subway. Being in the garment district always makes for fun window shopping and bargins so consider that also if you have a clothes fetish.
reviews.title: Awesome Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel itself is smaller, clean, rooms are decent sized and newly furnished and finished. Bathrooms are new, clean and also decent sized. Flat sceeen TV, microwave, refer, coffee maker, room safe and free wireless in room. Dresser and standard size desk, and good sized closet also. For the reasonable room rates the room amenities and condition are excellent.
reviews.title: Good Midtown Hotel
"Wingate Wyndham NYC" is a great place to stay!
reviews.text: Small fitness room and second floor open area with large TV, there is also a small business center also. There is a bar and restaurant on site which also provides the free breakfast in the AM. Hot choices of eggs, sausage, make-your-own waffles and plenty of breads, pastries, toast, cereals, yogurt, juice, coffee etc. More than the "average" cold continental offered at many of these mid-priced hotels now. Very suitable to get you going in the AM for a freebie.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As for the concerns of noise - well I can tell you on the weekend that's not much of a problem; but certainly I can see it could be an issue on weekdays - for those lower rooms facing streetside. Obviously the hotel is aware of this since they provide a white noise machine and ear plugs in the room. An option is to ask for one of the rear rooms or at least a room on a higher floor (during the week when garbage collection is more prevelent since this street is a working-garment/office area). During a weekend it was not an issue at all (Sat/Sun). This is possibly the only concern you should have - depending on your stay.
reviews.title: great hotel in great location

reviews.text: We stayed at the Wingate last week for 7 days. I traveled with my wife and teenager son. We had a great stay. Our room (two dbl very conf. beds)was at 16th floor quiet and clean.The room, location (very close to 34th str. Subway stations -1,2,3 and A-E lines-, Penn Station or Port Authority and Path Train) and overall service was excellent.Check-in and check out was very easy and fast.Room was very clean, LCD TV, safe that can hold a laptop, free internet, continental breakfast,iron and ironing table,umbrella was very good thinking. Also the bed was big enough for two people, there was a microwave and fridge and daily newspapers (USA Today-in week days)delivered to your room.I will definitely stay here again on my next visit to the city.
reviews.title: wonderful experience

reviews.text: Found this highly rated hotel through trip advisor and booked several months in advance to take advantage of special.
reviews.title: Great location in mid-town, excellent hotel value

reviews.text: The location was excellent, short walk to shopping (Macy's around the corner) Times Square and Hell's Kitchen restaurants.
reviews.title: ??? Was I in same hotel at all???

reviews.text: Easy access to Penn Station with direct connecting trains to EWR Newark Airport
reviews.title: the rat motel

reviews.text: Extensive breakfast included for three of us.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience

reviews.text: I arrived at the Wingate by Wyndham hotel on an unusually warm Sunday afternoon (around 96 degrees) to a attend a number of business meetings on the following couple of days. On arrival I was given a room where the air conditioner created loud vibrations, even when turned off. The hotel moved me to another room. In that room the A/C unit did not work at all and after insisting to be moved to yet another room, that A/C unit ceased to work today, Monday afternoon.
reviews.title: repeated A/C failures, poor response by management

likes.liked: — free internet, both wired and wireless

reviews.text: While the engineers were trying all they could, the assistant hotel manager rang me later on purely to say that there was no issue with the A/C unit. It was clear that he just wanted to prevent me from making a claim against that hotel. I had no intention of doing so anyway.
reviews.title: Nice Small Hotel, Safe, Clean and we'd do it again

likes.liked: — Price, very clean, good location, helpful staff, modern feel
likes.disliked: — The street is a little shady looking and bit dirty

reviews.text: To top it off, overnight from Sunday to Monday, the warm water supply failed for the entire hotel.
reviews.title: Friendly staff, great location!

reviews.text: The hotel is small and between two larger buildings. Lounge is small but it is very clean and updated and modern. The desk clerks were very attentive and seemed like they enjoyed their work and were very helpful with questions when we arrived.
reviews.title: Best Stay in New York

likes.liked: — The staff were wonderful and the accomodations were excellent.
likes.disliked: — The elevators are a bit slow.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were placed onto the 16th floor and the room was a bit smaller than we expected for 3 people with double beds but it was very clean, spotless and suited us fine.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel

likes.disliked: — There was nothing i didn't like

reviews.title: Great location, wonderful staff
reviews.text: We picked this hotel purely for it's location between Times Square and Madison Square Garden. It was easy to walk to the subway and easy to get around. The interior of the hotel is newly renovated and very nice. Everyone that we encountered on the staff where helpful and friendly. I would easily recommend this hotel to anyone and look forward to staying there during my next trip to NYC.

Upon arrival we were greeted politely and since the rooms weren't ready they checked our bags for us so we could go have lunch. The rooms were clean and beds were comfortable. They served a hot breakfast each morning that was good. For the price and location, I would highly recommend this hotel; we will stay there on our next trip to NYC!
reviews.title: I would recommend this hotel
New York City
reviews.text: New York City, April 2009

reviews.title: Great Value!
reviews.text: My husband and I finally made it New York City this Spring and had a wonderful trip. We stayed at the Wyndham Midtown which was very clean and convenient to all attractions. It's a rehabbed place so the bedding & carpeting was new. Continental breakfast was included in our stay & they have a little patio in the back. The bathroom was very spacious which is unusual for NYC. We flew into JFK from St. Louis (Lambert) and then took the A-train & subway to Penn Station. We then walked to our hotel. The hop on hop off bus was perfect for our first two days there. The views from the top are amazing. After that we used our Metro Card for the subway which was pretty easy to use. We spent one day at Ellis Island & had purchased our ferry tickets online in advance. We got last minute Letterman tickets, but the highlight of our trip for me was the Broadway show "Blithe Spirit" featuring Angela Lansbury. The food at Dallas Bar-b-que in Times Square was delicious & inexpensive. It's a fun place to visit,, but wear good walking shoes and stop & pick up a map at the Visitor Center when you arrive.
Good Location- close to subway, manhattan attractions
reviews.title: Great location & helpful staff

reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Wingate August 11 12 13, 2009. It was during our family visit to NYC. The staff were friendly, professional, knowledgeable and seemed always ready to help. Room was very nice and clean. Microwave and fridge in the room were very handy. The breakfasts were awesome and the morning staff always greeted us with a good morning and have a nice day. Makes the vacation that much nicer. We were able to communicate electronically via the 2 pcs located on the 2nd floor. Very nice ambiance. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in NYC and would gladly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Family fun in New York City

reviews.text: ML
reviews.title: Great service, great rooms

reviews.text: Ottawa, Canada
reviews.title: Great stay, Sacia at front desk was extremely helpful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed with a group of 9 people, ranging from 3yrs old to 57yrs old. We booked through hotels.com the same day and obtained the rooms at $165/night tax included. We were wrapping up a vacation in an RV and called the hotel concierge to ask for assistance in finding a parking lot in Manhattan that could accommodate a 30foot long RV. The concierge was extremely helpful, called various places and find us a place about 12 blocks away. Everyone at the hotel was very friendly & serviceable.
reviews.title: Were given the worst room in hotel, even though we booked 7 months ago

reviews.text: The rooms were small, but larger than some NYC rooms I've stayed in. Most importantly the rooms were very clean, the beds were super comfortable, the bathroom was very clean and modern and though only with a shower, it was a larger shower. The breakfast was good, I had one of the best omelets. The location was great for going uptown or downtown.
reviews.title: Great Location - Worth the Stay !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Wingate last weekend for the U.S. Open, and the convenience to Penn Station and the LIRR was unbeatable. The front desk was helpful and friendly, the rooms were bigger than many in NY, and the free breakfast was, well, free.
reviews.title: convenient location, used soap

reviews.text: There were, however, some problems. I realize that $250/night is fairly cheap for midtown NY standards, and I am all for ecologically friendly hotels, but . . . . we were given two used soaps in a new soap box. The other issues were that the shower curtain had lots of mildew on it, the bathroom was generally not clean, the air conditioner was extremely loud, and the walls were paper-thin. Moreover, as everyone else has noted, they often run out of breakfast food.
reviews.title: spectacular !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, a decent experience -- but the hotel could use some improvements.
reviews.title: A haven in the city

reviews.text: I am sitting in my room this very minute writing my review because I am so pleased with our experience here that I could not wait until I got home. I just came upstairs from eating my fantastic FREE continental breakfast. Eggs, sausage (bacon yesterday) bagels, toast, cereal, muffins, belgian waffles, fresh fruit, 4 kinds of juices, coffee and specialty teas. I am not even sure if I got everything. The room is exceptionally clean, and very roomy by NYC hotel standards. The front desk people have been more than kind and friendly. I personally booked this room based on these reviews only, so that is why I am writing mine so quickly. Everything is within walking distance and for the price I don't think there is a better deal out there. My husband and our 2 young daughters were here for a yankee game and the american girl doll store. It has just been a wonderful experience and I am so sad to leave tomorrow. I would highly recommend this hotel and for sure would stay here again. Oh and the fridge is great for leftovers with the microwave on top to reheat them. Free wireless internet also worked perfectly. If I could give this hotel 10 stars I would. Not one single complaint about anything. This is the best hotel in midtown and a great value for the money.
reviews.title: A Little Gem

likes.liked: — Spacious rooms, cleanliness, convenience, pleasant staff

reviews.text: This hotel is absolutely perfect in it's own class. It's got great service, friendly staff, clean rooms (and both my wife and I are difficult to please) and the rooms look nice at that.
reviews.title: Thumbs Up!!

reviews.text: Great Hotel for families.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room (2 double beds) was a good size and modern and clean. Fridge and Microwave are a plus. Good range of food at breakfast (although they did run out of some things at times).
reviews.title: Totally Loved It!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good location although West-side area is a little dowdy. Handy to subway stations (hint walk only half a block west for the Blue Subway line)
reviews.title: Great Location & Excellent help !!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for a week in June 2008 and totally loved it. This was a first-time trip to NYC and it was just perfect. We couldn't have asked for a better hotel. I have no complaints what so ever about this hotel. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. The room was super clean. The breakfast could use a little improvement, but the hotel overall was just wonderful. The location was superb and close to everything. The closest subway station was a 5 min. walk. Times Square was about a 10 min walk. Macys was just around the corner. There were many wonderful places to eat that were all nearby. We are, with out a doubt, definitely staying here again.
reviews.title: Fab, Ideal place

likes.liked: — It was in a central position for amenities for exploring New York

reviews.text: We stayed at the Wingate this past weekend and it was a great hotel for the price. The hotel is within walking distance of everything you want to see in Mid Town. The hotel is located on w35thst. but it is well lit up at night and felt safe coming to the hotel late at night. The front desk was very helpful with the subway system and everyone said hello every morning or even late at night. I would stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: Wingate a WINNER!!!

aka: Wingate By Wyndham Manhattan Midtown Hotel
description: The Wingate by Wyndham Manhattan Midtown New York City Hotel is located just 1/2 block from Macys and Herald Square in the heart of the Garment/Fashion District, two blocks from Madison Square Garden and Penn Station and just moments away from such famous landmarks as the Empire State Building - 4 blocks, Times Square - 7 blocks, Bryant Park - 10 blocks, the Theater District - 10 blocks, and the Jacob Javits Convention Center - 10 blocks. At Wingate by Wyndham, we know you mean business. Our ninety-two spacious guestrooms and suites feature a well-lit work area, complimentary high speed internet access-wired and wireless, two line phones and remote printing from your room. The Wingate by Wyndham Manhattan Midtown is now offering FREE long distance calls to our guests.
